definitionGroups.group: A deceptive, irregular, or false form; specifically:

entries.meaning: (geology, mineralogy) A mineral that formed by replacement of an existing mineral (or organic matter) such that the new mineral has the appearance and dimensions of the original.
examples: Petrified wood is a silicic pseudomorph of the original wood.

verbs.description: pseudomorph (third-person singular simple present pseudomorphs, present participle pseudomorphing, simple past and past participle pseudomorphed)

entries.meaning: To be transformed into such a form
